info.title: @bitgo/master-bitgo-express
info.description: Advanced Wallets - On-Premises Key Management with BitGo Express

post.summary: Accelerate unconfirmed transactions on UTXO-based blockchains.
post.description: Supports Child-Pays-For-Parent (CPFP) and Replace-By-Fee (RBF) acceleration methods.

schema.description: Request type for the transaction acceleration endpoint. Used to accelerate unconfirmed transactions on UTXO-based blockchains using CPFP or RBF.

pubkey.description: Public key used for signing the acceleration transaction.

source.description: The key to use for signing the transaction.

items.description: Transaction IDs to accelerate using Child-Pays-For-Parent (CPFP). CPFP creates a new transaction that spends an output from the original transaction.

cpfpFeeRate.description: Fee rate in satoshis per byte for the CPFP transaction. Higher fee rates result in faster confirmations but higher transaction costs.

maxFee.description: Maximum fee in satoshis for the acceleration transaction. Helps prevent overpaying for transaction acceleration.

items.description: Transaction IDs to accelerate using Replace-By-Fee (RBF). RBF creates a new transaction that replaces the original transaction. The original transaction must have been created with RBF enabled.

feeMultiplier.description: Fee multiplier for RBF transactions. The new fee will be the original fee multiplied by this value.

txid.description: The transaction ID (hash) of the acceleration transaction. This can be used to track the transaction on a block explorer.

tx.description: The full signed transaction in hexadecimal format. This transaction can be broadcast to the network.

source.description: The key to use for signing the transaction

amount.description: The amount in base units (e.g. satoshis) to send. For doge, only string is allowed.

items.description: List of recipient addresses and amounts to send

pubkey.description: Public key of the key used for signing multisig transactions i.e if source is user, this is the user's public key if source is backup, this is the backup key's public key

commonKeychain.description: For TSS wallets, this is the common keychain of the wallet, it remains the same whether source is user or backup

numBlocks.description: (BTC only) The number of blocks required to confirm a transaction. You can use `numBlocks` to estimate the fee rate by targeting confirmation within a given number of blocks. If both `feeRate` and `numBlocks` are absent, the transaction defaults to 2 blocks for confirmation. Note: The `maxFeeRate` limits the fee rate generated by `numBlocks`.

feeRate.description: Custom fee rate (in base units) per kilobyte (or virtual kilobyte). For example, satoshis per kvByte. If the `feeRate` is less than the minimum required network fee, then the minimum fee applies. For example, 1000 sat/kvByte, a flat 1000 microAlgos, or a flat 10 drops of xrp. For XRP, the actual fee is usually 4.5 times the open ledger fee. Note: The `feeRate` overrides the `maxFeeRate` and `minFeeRate`.

feeMultiplier.description: (UTXO only) Custom multiplier to the `feeRate`. The resulting fee rate is limited by the `maxFeeRate`. For replace-by-fee (RBF) transactions (that include `rbfTxIds`), the `feeMultiplier` must be greater than 1, since it's an absolute fee multiplier to the transaction being replaced. Note: The `maxFeeRate` limits the fee rate generated by `feeMultiplier`.

maxFeeRate.description: (BTC only) The maximum fee rate (in base units) per kilobyte (or virtual kilobyte). For example, satoshis per kvByte. The `maxFeeRate` limits the fee rate generated by both `feeMultiplier` and `numBlocks`. Note: The `feeRate` overrides the `maxFeeRate`.

minConfirms.description: The unspent selection for the transaction will only consider unspents with at least this many confirmations to be used as inputs. Does not apply to change outputs unless used in combination with `enforceMinConfirmsForChange`.

enforceMinConfirmsForChange.description: When set to true, will enforce minConfirms for change outputs. Defaults to false.

targetWalletUnspents.description: Specifies the minimum count of good-sized unspents to maintain in the wallet. Change splitting ceases when the wallet has `targetWalletUnspents` good-sized unspents. Note: Wallets that continuously send a high count of transactions will automatically split large change amounts into multiple good-sized change outputs while they have fewer than `targetWalletUnspents` good-sized unspents in their unspent pool. Breaking up large unspents helps to reduce the amount of unconfirmed funds in flight in future transactions, and helps to avoid long chains of unconfirmed transactions. This is especially useful for newly funded wallets or recently refilled send-only wallets.

message.description: Optional metadata (only persisted in BitGo) to be applied to the transaction. Use this to add transaction-specific information such as the transaction's purpose or another identifier that you want to reference later. The value is shown in the UI in the transfer listing page.

minValue.description: Ignore unspents smaller than this amount of base units (e.g. satoshis). For doge, only string is allowed.

maxValue.description: Ignore unspents larger than this amount of base units (e.g. satoshis). For doge, only string is allowed.

sequenceId.description: A `sequenceId` is a unique and arbitrary wallet identifier applied to transfers and transactions at creation. It is optional but highly recommended. With a `sequenceId` you can easily reference transfers and transactionsâ€”for example, to safely retry sending. Because the system only confirms one send request per `sequenceId` (and fails all subsequent attempts), you can retry sending without the risk of double spending. The `sequenceId` is only visible to users on the wallet and is not shared publicly.

lastLedgerSequence.description: (XRP only) Absolute max ledger the transaction should be accepted in, whereafter it will be rejected

ledgerSequenceDelta.description: (XRP only) Relative ledger height (in relation to the current ledger) that the transaction should be accepted in, whereafter it will be rejected

noSplitChange.description: Set `true` to disable automatic change splitting. Also see: `targetWalletUnspents`

items.description: Used to explicitly specify the unspents to be used in the input set in the transaction. Each unspent should be in the form `prevTxId:nOutput`.

comment.description: Optional metadata (only persisted in BitGo) to be applied to the transaction. Use this to add transaction-specific information such as the transaction's purpose or another identifier that you want to reference later. The value is shown in the UI in the transfer listing page.

otp.description: Two factor auth code to enable sending the transaction. Not necessary if using a long lived access token within the spending limit.

changeAddress.description: Specifies a custom destination address for the transaction's change output(s)

allowExternalChangeAddress.description: Flag for allowing external change addresses

instant.description: (DASH only) Specifies whether or not to use Dash's "InstantSend" feature when sending a transaction.

memo.description: Extra transaction information for CSPR, EOS, HBAR, RUNE, STX, TON, XLM, and XRP. Required for XLM transactions. Note: For XRP this is the destination tag (DT). For CSPR this is the transfer ID.

gasLimit.description: Custom gas limit to be used for sending the transaction. Only for ETH and ERC20 tokens.

nonce.description: (DOT only) A nonce ID is a number used to protect private communications by preventing replay attacks. This is an advanced option where users can manually input a new nonce value in order to correct or fill in a missing nonce ID value.

post.summary: Generates a new onPrem self-managed cold wallet.
post.description:
The wallet creation process involves several steps that happen automatically:
1. User Keychain Creation: Creates the user keychain in the advanced wallet manager and encrypts it with the respective KMS.
2. Backup Keychain Creation: Creates the backup keychain in the advanced wallet manager and encrypts it with the respective KMS.
3. Keychain Upload: Uploads the user/backup public keys to BitGo.
4. BitGo Key Creation: Creates the BitGo key on the BitGo service.
5. Wallet Creation: Creates the wallet on BitGo with the 3 keys.

label.description: A human-readable label for the wallet This will be displayed in the BitGo dashboard and API responses

multisigType.description: The type of multisig wallet to create - onchain: Traditional multisig wallets using on-chain scripts - tss: Threshold Signature Scheme wallets using MPC protocols If absent, BitGo uses the default wallet type for the asset

enterprise.description: Enterprise ID - Required for Ethereum wallets Ethereum wallets can only be created under an enterprise Each enterprise has a fee address which will be used to pay for transaction fees Your enterprise ID can be seen by clicking on the "Manage Organization" link on the enterprise dropdown

disableTransactionNotifications.description: Flag for disabling wallet transaction notifications When true, BitGo will not send email/SMS notifications for wallet transactions

isDistributedCustody.description: True, if the wallet type is a distributed-custodial If passed, you must also pass the 'enterprise' parameter Distributed custody allows multiple parties to share control of the wallet

walletVersion.description: Specify the wallet creation contract version used when creating an Ethereum wallet contract - 0: Old wallet creation (legacy) - 1: New wallet creation, only deployed upon receiving funds - 2: Same functionality as v1 but with NFT support - 3: MPC wallets

post.summary: Recover funds from an existing wallet using user and backup keys.
post.description: This endpoint allows for both standard multisig and TSS wallet recovery.

schema.description: Request type for the wallet recovery endpoint. Used to recover funds from both standard multisig and TSS wallets.

isTssRecovery.description: Set to true to perform a TSS (Threshold Signature Scheme) recovery.

tssRecoveryParams.description: Parameters specific to TSS recovery. Required when isTssRecovery is true.

commonKeychain.description: The common keychain string used for TSS wallets. Required for TSS recovery.

multiSigRecoveryParams.description: Parameters specific to standard multisig recovery. Required when isTssRecovery is false (default).

bitgoPub.description: The BitGo public key. Required for UTXO coins, optional for others.

walletContractAddress.description: The wallet contract address. Required for ETH-like recoveries.

recoveryDestinationAddress.description: The address where recovered funds will be sent. Must be a valid address for the coin being recovered.

apiKey.description: API Key for a block chain explorer. Required for some coins (BTC, ETH) to build a recovery transaction without BitGo.

coinSpecificParams.description: Coin-specific recovery options. Different parameters are required based on the coin family: - For UTXO coins (BTC, etc): provide utxoRecoveryOptions. - For EVM chains (ETH, etc): provide evmRecoveryOptions. - For Solana: provide solanaRecoveryOptions.

evmRecoveryOptions.description: EVM-specific recovery parameters for Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains. Used for recovering funds from standard multisig wallets on Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains. Required when recovering ETH, MATIC, BSC, AVAX C-Chain, etc.

eip1559.description: EIP-1559 gas parameters for modern Ethereum transactions. Required for EIP-1559 compatible networks (Ethereum post-London fork).

maxFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas in wei (base fee + priority fee).

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum priority fee per gas in wei (tip for miners/validators).

gasLimit.description: Gas limit for the recovery transaction. Must be enough to cover the contract execution costs.

gasPrice.description: Gas price in wei for the recovery transaction (for legacy transactions). Higher gas prices result in faster confirmations but higher transaction costs.

replayProtectionOptions.description: Replay protection options for the transaction. Required to prevent transaction replay attacks across different chains.

hardfork.description: Hardfork name to determine the transaction format.

scan.description: Number of addresses to scan for funds. Higher values will scan more addresses but take longer to complete.

closeAtaAddress.description: The close associated token account address. Required for token recovery.

durableNonce.description: Durable nonce configuration for transaction durability. Optional but recommended for recovery operations. Refer to https://github.com/BitGo/wallet-recovery-wizard/blob/master/DURABLE_NONCE.md on durable nonce creation.

publicKey.description: The public key of the durable nonce account.

secretKey.description: The secret key of the durable nonce account.

programId.description: The program ID for the token. Required for token recovery.

recoveryDestinationAtaAddress.description: The recovery destination's associated token account address. Required for token recovery.

tokenContractAddress.description: The token contract address for token recovery. Required when recovering tokens.

utxoRecoveryOptions.description: UTXO-specific recovery parameters for Bitcoin & Bitcoin-like cryptocurrencies. Used for recovering funds from standard multisig wallets on UTXO chains. Required when recovering BTC, BCH, LTC, DASH, ZEC, etc.

feeRate.description: Fee rate for the recovery transaction in satoshis per byte. Higher fee rates result in faster confirmations but higher transaction costs.

items.description: Array of address types to ignore during recovery. Useful when you want to exclude specific address types from the recovery process.

scan.description: Number of addresses to scan for funds. Higher values will scan more addresses but take longer to complete.

userKeyPath.description: Derivation path for the user key. Specifies the HD path to derive the correct user key for signing.

txHex.description: The full signed transaction in hexadecimal format. This transaction can be broadcast to the network to complete the recovery.

post.summary: Consolidate funds from multiple addresses in a wallet and sign with user & backup keys in a recovery situation.
post.description: Used for both standard multisig wallets and TSS wallets to consolidate funds from various addresses.

schema.description: Request type for wallet recovery consolidations endpoint. Used to consolidate and recover funds from multiple addresses in a wallet, via signing with user and backup keys.

userPub.description: The user's public key for standard multisig wallets. Required for onchain multisig recovery consolidations.

backupPub.description: The backup public key for standard multisig wallets. Required for onchain multisig recovery consolidations.

bitgoPub.description: The BitGo public key for standard multisig wallets. Required for onchain UTXO multisig recovery consolidations.

multisigType.description: The type of wallet to recover - onchain: Traditional multisig wallets. - tss: Threshold Signature Scheme wallets.

commonKeychain.description: The common keychain for TSS wallets. Required when multisigType is 'tss'.

tokenContractAddress.description: The token contract address for token recovery (e.g., ERC20 tokens on Ethereum or SPL tokens on Solana). Required when recovering specific tokens instead of the native coin.

startingScanIndex.description: The starting index to scan for addresses to consolidate. Useful for limiting the scan range for better performance.

endingScanIndex.description: The ending index to scan for addresses to consolidate. Useful for limiting the scan range for better performance.

apiKey.description: API key for blockchain explorer services. Required for some coins to build recovery transactions.

durableNonces.description: Durable nonces configuration for Solana transactions. Provides transaction durability for Solana recovery operations. Refer to https://github.com/BitGo/wallet-recovery-wizard/blob/master/DURABLE_NONCE.md on durable nonce creation.

items.description: Array of public keys associated with the durable nonce.

secretKey.description: The secret key of the durable nonce account.

items.description: Ids of users with access to the wallet

coin.description: Name of the blockchain the wallet is on

label.description: Name the user assigned to the wallet

m.description: Number of signatures required for the wallet to send

n.description: Number of signers on the wallet

keySignatures.description: Signatures for the backup and BitGo public keys signed by the user key

disableTransactionNotifications.description: Flag for disabling wallet transaction notifications

freeze.description: Freeze state (used to stop the wallet from spending)

deleted.description: Flag which indicates the wallet has been deleted

approvalsRequired.description: Number of admin approvals required for an action to fire

allowBackupKeySigning.description: Flag for allowing signing with backup key

recoverable.description: Flag indicating whether this wallet's user key is recoverable with the passphrase held by the user.

startDate.description: Time when this wallet was created

hasLargeNumberOfAddresses.description: Flag indicating that this wallet is large (more than 100,000 addresses). If this is set, some APIs may omit properties which are expensive to calculate for wallets with many addresses (for example, the total address counts returned by the List Addresses API).

config.description: Custom configuration options for this wallet

type.description: Keychain type (e.g. "independent" for onchain, "tss" for MPC)

pub.description: Public part of a key pair (onchain wallets)

ethAddress.description: Ethereum address corresponding to this keychain (onchain wallets)

coin.description: Asset ticker for this keychain (onchain wallets)

type.description: Keychain type (e.g. "independent" for onchain, "tss" for MPC)

isBitGo.description: Flag for identifying keychain as created by BitGo

isTrust.description: Flag for identifying keychain as trust keychain

hsmType.description: HSM type used for the BitGo key

pub.description: Public part of a key pair (onchain wallets)

ethAddress.description: Ethereum address corresponding to this keychain (onchain wallets)

verifiedVssProof.description: Whether VSS proof was verified (TSS wallets)

walletHSMGPGPublicKeySigs.description: Wallet HSM GPG public key signatures (TSS wallets)
